data.title: A great local bar and grill
data.text: I meet a friend for beers and food every couple of weeks or so.  We almost always go to the Train Station.  They have a great selection of beers on tap and their menu has a lot of choices.  I've never been disappointed by any of the food, and the wings are definitely some of the best in the area.  We get a mix of BBQ and medium hot sauce together for our wings.  The waitresses are also great.  They take good care of the customers and may even stop by to chat if things aren't too busy.  We've tried a couple of other places for our "let's do beers" get togethers, but tend to keep coming back to the Train Station.

data.title: A long lunch
data.text: Our first sign should have been an empty parking lot at lunch time.  We placed our order and 2 more tables came in after ours and got their food first.  This was after about a 20 minute wait.  When I checked my watch until the time I asked about our order was another 20 minutes. Service is very slow.  There was no apology for the slow service. When my food did arrive, it was not properly cooked.  I ordered medium well and it came back barely medium. The re-fired my burger, but it must have been in the microwave because it was only gone less than a minute. The burger was bland and not worth the $8,  this was 2 visits in one my first and last visit.

data.title: Still one of our favorite places!
data.text: We've been coming here for 10 years...we still love it. Good draft beers, really good salads and burgers (you can change almost anything listed on the menu). Come try it!

data.title: Dining
data.text: Great food and great service. A regular place for us. Great hamburgers, fish fry, steak, fries and more.

data.title: Really Good food.. aweosme experience
data.text: Really Good food.. aweosme experience...Really Good food.. aweosme experience,,,Really Good food.. aweosme experience

data.title: Lots of TVs!
data.text: Stopped in last Sat and watched the Stanley Cup hockey game.  Tons of TVs, lots of food and drink specials.   Waitstaff is very attentive.  Home cooking menu

data.title: Great food and good beer selection
data.text: I used to go to this place before a lot when it was Harrison's Wife and I stopped in a couple weeks ago and it is very much still like it was back then. The food is good here and they have a pretty good beer selection as well. The service was attentive and good. Prices are what you would expect in Cary. We will be going back here

data.title: A neighborhood gem
data.text:
Train Station is the latest incarnation of Harrison's Bar and Grill, which closed several years ago. We used to go to Harrison's in its early days, when it was truly a neighborhood pub and had a great beer selection, along with some very good food. 

We thought those days were well past, and were a little sad about it; it was one of our favorite hangouts.

Now, it's back, as Train Station Sports Bar and Grill. Yes, it has TVs, but they aren't loud (thank you, managers!). It's comfy. You can talk to everyone at your table and hear what they are saying. There's seating at tables or at the bar, and there is another half of the restaurant for pool tables and games, but you'd probably not realize it if you didn't look for it on entering. The food is definitely good, and sometimes even really creative and interesting. (Try the Katy Flyer burger, the Bayou salad, or the fish tacos.)  And--it has a nice list of craft beers available on tap. Some of the original waitstaff are still there, too. Not bad.

We're glad to see our neighborhood pub back again!
